intro: Rondeletia inermis var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rondeletia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
